info.game_comments:
First game of Season 31.
New title graphics.
Alex re-grows his mustache.

(1, 1).clue: On April 25, 1865, 6-year-old Teddy watched from a window as this man's funeral procession moved through Manhattan

(2, 1).clue: Cheerleaders know it traditionally precedes "sis, boom, bah!"

(3, 1).clue: One has St. Louis, the other has East St. Louis

(4, 1).clue: A variety of bawdy stage show, or reminding one of Mr. Ives

(5, 1).clue: DC Comic dubbed this character "The Clown Prince of Crime"

(6, 1).clue: In 1990 John Major was no longer minor as he succeeded this towering British prime minister

(1, 2).clue: Eleanor's triumph, passage of the UDHR, got her the first standing ovation for a single delegate in this organization's history

(2, 2).clue: In 1983 there was no harmony at this New York prison when inmates rioted over poor conditions

(3, 2).clue: Hoover Dam is on their border

(4, 2).clue: Pertaining to an Italian Renaissance painter, or in a very different mood, to TV's Sally Jessy

(5, 2).clue: Cam becomes Fizbo, "the (butt)-kicking clown that'll twist you like a balloon animal", on this ABC sitcom

(6, 2).clue: Isabel Peron, 3rd wife of Juan, surely cried after his death... until succeeding him as president of this country

(1, 3).clue: On accepting the 1932 nomination for president, FDR said, "I pledge you, I pledge myself to a" this "for the American people"

(2, 3).clue: In an '80s hit it precedes "Keep it down now, voices carry"

(3, 3).clue: The state where Martin Luther King was born & the state where he married Coretta Scott

(4, 3).clue: "Goddess" term meaning stately, or something a lot like that Ellen Page film

(5, 3).clue: On "In Living Color" this Damon Wayans clown "don't play that"

(6, 3).clue: In 1997 Sister Nirmala succeeded this woman as the head of the Missionaries of Charity

(1, 4).clue: Referring to this volunteer regiment & their victorious charge in Cuba, Teddy called it "the great day of my life"

(2, 4).clue: At foodnetwork.com recipes for this fish include Macadamia Nut Crusted & Grilled Tacos

(3, 4).clue: This big land buy named for one also got us the other

(4, 4).clue: Solid term suggesting massive, majestic beauty, or referring to Christ the Redemer

(5, 4).clue: This song begins, "Isn't it rich? Are we a pair? Me here at last on the ground, you in mid-air"

(6, 4).clue: David Muir was named to replace her as the regular anchor of "World News Tonight"

(1, 5).clue: Before her death in 1962, Eleanor made a final visit to the old family summer home on this Canadian island

(2, 5).clue: German health plans cover visits to a spa, including this one at the foothills of the Black Forest

(3, 5).clue: One has Rocky Mountain National Park, one has Cherokee National Park

(4, 5).clue: It refers specifically to an author who died in 1924, or broadly to senseless, menacing complexity

(5, 5).clue: In 1988 John Vernon, the dean in "Animal House", found more than 0.0 "Killer Klowns from" here

(6, 5).clue: After filling Ted Kennedy's shoes in Mass., this man decided to try out Jeanne Shaheen's senatorial ones in New Hampshire

(1, 1).clue: The lobetoothed type of this is found in the Orinoco, & uh-oh, it smells blood

(2, 1).clue: In 2013 & 2014 this rapper had a monster hit with "The Monster", featuring Rihanna

(3, 1).clue: Alkali flats, like the ones named for Mr. Bonneville, have very high concentrations of this, NaCl

(4, 1).clue: Now played throughout the world, it's often called England's national summer sport

(5, 1).clue: "My Posse Don't Do Homework" is LouAnne Johnson's memoir of her time in this profession

(6, 1).clue: It can mean "universal" or refer to a particular Christian denomination

(1, 2).clue: The cnidarian known as the box type of this kills its prey with some of the strongest venom in the world

(2, 2).clue: In 1973 this brother & sister duo were on top of the charts with "Top Of The World"

(3, 2).clue: Touting the "Zetetic Method", this "Society" believes that our planet is not spherical

(4, 2).clue: The royal baby's full name & title is His Royal Highness Prince George Alexander Louis of this scholarly city

(5, 2).clue: "All Creatures Great and Small launched a series on James Herriot's many year in this profession

(1, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows a video on the monitor.)  The grasshopper mouse is immune to the scorpion stings because these specialized cells act as a kind of gatekeeper by not sending the news of pain to the brain

(2, 3).clue: In 1971 this soulful man followed up "Tired Of Being Alone" with the No. 1 hit "Let's Stay Together"

(3, 3).clue: Fluke are a type of this invertebrate

(4, 3).clue: In 1613 a cannon spark during a performance of "Henry VIII" set this theater ablaze & it burned to the ground

(5, 3).clue: "Born Standing Up" is this man's story of bursting onto the comedy scene in the 1970s, white suit & all

(6, 3).clue: It's distilled from white wine & is named for a city in western France

(1, 4).clue: Haliaeetus leucocephalus, this big American bird, is known to bully osprey off their catches

(2, 4).clue: This reggae group does well with covers: their versions of "Red Red Wine" & "Can't Help Falling In Love" hit No. 1

(3, 4).clue: Published in 1935, it's named for a district once near Monterey

(4, 4).clue: During World War I this sister ship of the Lusitania was used to transport troops & as a hospital ship

(1, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows a video on the monitor.)  Scientists who studied foxes hunting in the snow found that, when the mammals align themselves properly with this field, they have a 73% chance of catching prey

(2, 5).clue: It is my belief that this Scott Stapp rock group had a No. 1 hit with the 2000 song "With Arms Wide Open"

(3, 5).clue: From Hindi for "flat" comes the 7-letter name of this unleavened bread of India

(4, 5).clue: For National Poetry Day in 2013, Prince Charles made a special recording of this poet's "Fern Hill"

(6, 5).clue: This era of geologic time includes the Tertiary & Quaternary periods

(0, 0).clue: In 1937 his sister said he had "hats of every description" which he would use as a "foundation of his next book"
